WorkItem.ClosedComment: This is fixed in the March 2009 release.
WorkItem.Description:
The workaround is:
<wpftoolkit:DataGridComboBoxColumn.ElementStyle>
          <Style TargetType="{x:Type ComboBox}">
                   <Setter Property="IsSynchronizedWithCurrentItem" Value="False"/>
          </Style>
</wpftoolkit:DataGridComboBoxColumn.ElementStyle>
 
which ofcourse is not pretty, would like to have:
<wpftoolkit:DataGridComboBoxColumn IsSynchronizedWithCurrentItem="False" />
 
the problem originates with a decision made for IsSynchronizedWithCurrentItem default value is set to a a null reference. which translates into the folowing behavior:
null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if the SelectedItem is synchronized with the current item only if the Selector uses a CollectionView.
 
therefore, the whole column will change the value, if IsSynchronizedWithCurrentItem is not explicitly set to false.
 
best regards,
  Jan Izaak Oosthoek
WorkItem.Summary: DataGridComboBoxColumn must have IsSynchronizedWithCurrentItem to support CollectionViewSource
